info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 9:59PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A CLUSTER OF THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT MECKLENBURG...SOUTHEASTERN GASTON...CHESTER...YORK...SOUTHEASTERN CHEROKEE AND NORTHEASTERN UNION COUNTIES UNTIL 1100 PM EDT... At 959 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the leading edge of a cluster of thunderstorms along a line extending from near Uptown Charlotte to 4 miles southwest of Rock Hill to 3 miles northwest of Chester to 7 miles northeast of Union, and moving southeast at 20 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Rock Hill, Uptown Charlotte, York, Chester, Gastonia, Central Charlotte, South Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, East Charlotte and Northwest Charlotte. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: The combination of gusty winds and saturated soil conditions will cause scattered trees and power lines to fall. Seek shelter inside an interior room. Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
